intro: Paraeremostachys thyrsiflora, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, with showy bracts. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to retain water in arid environments. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in high-altitude meadows.
